no, but logic died in a poof of logic which in turn means that logic never existed so logic could not die in a poof of logic which means that logic did not die which means it then died again in a poof of logic which in turn means that logic never existed so logic could not die in a poof of logic which means that logic did not die which means it then died again in a poof of logic which in turn means that logic never existed so logic could not die in a poof of logic which means that logic did not die which means it then died again in a poof of logic which in turn means that logic never existed so logic could not die in a poof of logic which means that logic did not die which means it then died again in a poof of logic...

its the law of the paradox

the user below me is confused beond all hope and is about to dieand the falowing statment is true. the previous statment is false.
